channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY

Shipment also contains UN1266, Paint, Class 3 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Bottle Material of Construction: Glass Package Capacity: 10 mi Amount in Package: 10 mi Number in Shipment: 3 Number Failed: 3

item.title: Report E-2024080428
item.description:
Report E-2024080428

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: AMSTERDAM
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 1, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was damaged in transit by unsecured freight and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the impacted site. Crews overpacked one (1) 55-gallon drum of Brake and Parts Cleaner into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. Crews transported the drum to Antioch R+L terminal for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080261
item.description:
Report E-2024080261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: LIVERPOOL
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FREEHOLD CARTAGE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 25, 2024, three (3) 55-gallon drums of UN2922 waste spilled in transit due to improper containment. As a result, the drums released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior, which further migrated to the parking lot below. Freehold Cartage retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental (ME) to remediate the impacted site. ME personnel utilized a vacuum pump to transfer product to a new 55-gallon poly drum. Crews worked to contain the release underneath and around the exterior of the trailer. ME personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date for additional remedial operations. On July 26, 2024, a crew from ME returned to the site for additional remediation. ME personnel utilized a pallet jack to transfer the undamaged freight to the trailer for normal transport. All UN2922 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080318
item.description:
Report E-2024080318

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-28
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 29, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN2680 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and a vacuum unit to remediate the site. All loose product and the damaged bag were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All cleanup debris and PPE were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum
